item.title: Balatro Has Generated Approximately $4.4 Million on Mobile
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/balatro-has-generated-approximately-4-4-million-on-mobile/

New data reveals that Game of the Year nominee Balatro has generated approximately $4.4 million on its mobile version.

PocketPair, which obtained the data via AppMagic, revealed the new data. According to the data, Balatro generated $1 million in its first week, and following a spending surge last week, that number quickly rose to $4.4 million.

It is unclear why the surge in purchases increased, but the game was nominated for several awards last week, which almost certainly attributed to its rise in popularity. The game received several awards at different events, including five at Geoff Keighley’s Game Awards 2024, including Game of the Year and Best Mobile Game.

Balatro was first released on February 20, 2024, and saw huge success on launch, generating $1 million in its first eight hours of release. It sold 250,000 units in its first three days and 500,000 copies in its first ten days. In August 2024, it was announced that the game had sold two million copies. The game received universal acclaim according to review aggregator Metacritic.

In August 2024, Balatro announced its first major crossover with some of the most popular games, including The Witcher 3, Among Us, Vampire Surivors, and Dave the Diver.

item.title: Kai Cenat Beats Twitch Sub Record – But He Had to Hang Someone Along The Way
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/kai-cenat-twitch-sub-record-hanging/

Kai Cenat has beaten his subscriber world record, racking up more than 580,000 concurrent Twitch subscribers during his Mafiathon 2 superstream. He has easily stormed past all previously set records, and since November 2, his channel has been live 24 hours a day. There’s no sign of the subathon slowing down.

Earlier today, the superstar streamer found himself in hot water following a bit on his broadcast that saw him and his friends ‘hang’ someone, prompting Kai to be concerned about getting banned from Twitch for what was later revealed to be a planned prank.

Did Kai Hang Someone?

On social media, clips of the event are being circulated like wildfire, showing a topless man hanging from a high bar on Kai Cenat’s stream. A rope is pulled and the man, whose hands are bound, hangs for a few seconds, kicking his legs, until he’s brought down from the noose.

He’s then tended to by a medical team.

At first blush, Kai and his team seemed to be shocked and perplexed about the event. They’d strolled out into Kai’s garden not knowing what to expect, then they found a man willing to be hoisted up in a noose live on stream – for clout and content, of course.

As a preface, it was revealed that the man being hung was Max Major, a YouTube ‘magician’ with a professional penchant for tricks like this. Later on, Kai shared a video, in which Major explained:

What you don’t know is that was all according to my plan. See, at the start of my performance, I said that tonight was all about choices. But not just the choices that you made tonight, but the choices that you made since the day that we met.

Since the first time we met, you pushed me, you challenged me, and you wanted to see me fail. And I thought tonight, I’ll give you exactly what you asked for.

By that point, Kai had already beaten his Twitch subscriber record, but the stunt was able to push him even further and put him in a high-ranking position on various social media platforms as a trending topic.

item.title: Shuhei Yoshida Leaving PlayStation In January
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/shuhei-yoshida-leaving-playstation-in-january/

PlayStation veteran Shuhei Yoshida is leaving PlayStation in January. His retirement comes after more than 30 years with Sony, spending his time with PlayStation since its beginnings in 1993.

Yoshida, who made the announcement on the official PlayStation Blog, is set to leave PlayStation on January 15, 2025.

“I’ve been with PlayStation from the beginning, and this is my 31st year with PlayStation,” he said. “And when I hit 30 years, I was thinking, hmm, it may be about time for me to move on.

“You know, the company’s been doing great. I love PS5, I love the games that are coming out on this platform. And we have new generations of management who I respect and admire. And I’m so excited for the future of PlayStation.” 

Yoshida has spent the last while as Head of Indies Initiative for Sony. Prior to that, he was President of SIE Worldwide Studis from 2008 to 2019.

While he’s been a part of large moments in PlayStation history, one may stand out to fans the most. In 2013, while Sony was unveiling the PlayStation 4 (PS4) at E3 2013, Sony took a jab at Microsoft’s disastrous Xbox One reveal earlier the same day. In short tutorial video, Yoshida and former Vice President of Publisher and Developer Relations Adam Boyes showed fans how they can share used games on the PS4.

At the time of publishing, Sony hasn’t made any official announcement regarding who will take over for Yoshida as Head of Indies Initiative.

When making his decision to leave, Yoshida said that he believes PlayStation “is in really good hands” moving forward.

“I thought, okay, this is my time,” he said.

item.title: Is Tranzit Coming to Black Ops 6 Zombies?
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/is-tranzit-coming-to-black-ops-6-zombies/

Black Ops 6 features classic CoD Zombies, marking a true return to form. The series has seen a litany of iconic Zombies maps down the years, but Tranzit is highly regarded, and much loved, and rumors abound the legendary locale could be ready for another round in BLOPS 6.

It’s been a joy to play both Liberty Falls and Terminus in Black Ops 6 Zombies. They each possess characteristics and sport trademarks of the great Zombies maps of yore. With Citadelle des Morts on the way, Black Ops 6 Zombies fans are being spoiled.

With three Zombies maps already confirmed, the internet is already rife with speculation about a potential fourth. If gossip is to be believed, the fourth—or any subsequent maps—may turn back the pages of history and welcome back Tranzit to a new audience.

Will Tranzit Come to Zombies in Black Ops 6? DLC rumors

There is no confirmation of Tranzit returning in Call of Duty: Black Ops 6, and nothing has leaked via data mining at this moment.

Anything you read about Tranzit returning in Black Ops 6 is pure speculation and conjecture. There is genuinely nothing to substantiate this rumor, but there is a reason why the Tranzit conversation continues to lurk around every undead corner.

Why is Tranzit rumored for Black Ops 6?

The Black Ops 6 Tranzit rumor is based on the “Black Ops 6: ‘The Truth Lies’ – Live Action Reveal Trailer” launched on Call of Duty’s official YouTube channel back on May 28.

Several references pertaining to Tranzit pop up during the 57-second trailer. You can see the footage in its entirety below.

Interestingly, one of Call of Duty’s leading social media personalities, where Zombies is concerned—MrRoflWaffles—broke down why they think Tranzit is destined for a revisit in Black Ops 6.

They found several familiar-looking objects and locations in the trailer, and went as far as to say a “Tranzit-inspired remake” could be on the cards, but stressed it’s only a “theory.”

Again, this is all we have on the Tranzit rumors right now. Trust me, I want to see the map return just as badly as many of you reading this right now do.

If you’re a newer CoD player, Black Ops 2’s Tranzit has a special place for many due to its unique map design—featuring a moving bus taking you to several mini-locations all within the overall confines of the map. You could also customize and upgrade the bus mid-round, and it’s still one of the most original Zombies maps to date.

Keep checking back as you never, we may find official information confirming or shutting down the Tranzit rumor.
